title: A user can bypass approval step in Hacker Publishing feature, allowing them to publish reports immediately

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
Hi team
**Description:**
Hacker can request agree-on-going-public publish report
### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create publish report
2. 

https://hackerone.com/reports/bulk
POST
message=&reference=&add_reporter_to_original=false&reply_action=agree-on-going-public&reports_count=1&report_ids%5B%5D=██████████&bounty_currency=USD

███

## Impact

Hacker can request agree-on-going-public publish report
Hacker bypasses the check by the moderator
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:
Hi team
Description:
Hacker can request agree-on-going-public publish report

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Create publish report

https://hackerone.com/reports/bulk
POST
message=&reference=&add_reporter_to_original=false&reply_action=agree-on-going-public&reports_count=1&report_ids%5B%5D=██████████&bounty_currency=USD

███

Impact

Hacker can request agree-on-going-public publish report
Hacker bypasses the check by the moderator

additional_data.new_title: Hacker can use request `agree-on-going-public` published report to bypass the check of the moderator and disclose report

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - nice find! We were able to reproduce the vulnerability you reported. We will escalate this to the team and keep you posted throughout the process. We've removed the disclosed report for the time being. Please do not disclose any other reports. Thanks again, good luck, and happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - nice find! We were able to reproduce the vulnerability you reported. We will escalate this to the team and keep you posted throughout the process. We've removed the disclosed report for the time being. Please do not disclose any other reports. Thanks again, good luck, and happy hacking!

activities.message: Hi @jobert -- During the test, I wondered if the publish Report will be displayed in my inbox after the disclosure?I didn't have time to check it during the test, and now I can't check it at your request not to disclose more reports.Can you check this case? Thank you!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @jobert -- During the test, I wondered if the publish Report will be displayed in my inbox after the disclosure?I didn't have time to check it during the test, and now I can't check it at your request not to disclose more reports.Can you check this case? Thank you!

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - if that were to be the case, what do you think the problem is with that? Any report that you publish can be found through the Inbox (I believe it's under All).
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - if that were to be the case, what do you think the problem is with that? Any report that you publish can be found through the Inbox (I believe it's under All).

activities.message:
Hey @jobert -- 
>if that were to be the case, what do you think the problem is with that?

I'll explain. I wanted to know about two conditions.

I want to understand the behavior of two reports, whether they will be displayed in inbox

1)When the report is opened and it has been sent to an external program with a private part
2)When the report opens and it was sent to an external program without the private part

I mean, after all the corrections, I don't know how open reports behave. And if they are displayed only those that the private part of the program, then it also makes sense
Thanks
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @jobert --

if that were to be the case, what do you think the problem is with that?

I'll explain. I wanted to know about two conditions.

I want to understand the behavior of two reports, whether they will be displayed in inbox

1)When the report is opened and it has been sent to an external program with a private part
2)When the report opens and it was sent to an external program without the private part

I mean, after all the corrections, I don't know how open reports behave. And if they are displayed only those that the private part of the program, then it also makes sense
Thanks

activities.message:
Hi @haxta4ok00 - thanks for your patience. We've released a fix for the security vulnerability. Can you do a quick sanity check to make sure it's resolved? Thanks!

> When the report is opened and it has been sent to an external program with a private part

In our backend, the report is already marked as Resolved. It just has an additional flag that it needs to be reviewed by our staff to actually make it public on the Hacktivity feed. This was exactly what you were able to bypass: the approval step.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @haxta4ok00 - thanks for your patience. We've released a fix for the security vulnerability. Can you do a quick sanity check to make sure it's resolved? Thanks!

When the report is opened and it has been sent to an external program with a private part

In our backend, the report is already marked as Resolved. It just has an additional flag that it needs to be reviewed by our staff to actually make it public on the Hacktivity feed. This was exactly what you were able to bypass: the approval step.

activities.message: Awesome, thanks for confirming @haxta4ok00! I've redacted the report IDs and attachments. This should be ready for disclosure. Thanks again, good luck, and happy hacking!
